adjectives.description: adversarial (comparative more adversarial, superlative most adversarial)

entries.meaning: Characteristic of, or in the manner of, an adversary; combative, hostile, opposed.
(law) In which issues are tried through the presentation of evidence and argument by adverse parties, with no or limited inquiry by the court's own initiative.
examples: Canada uses an adversarial system of criminal justice, whereas France uses an inquisitorial model.
